trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search index in the portal | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search index in the portal | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Add an index to Azure Search service by filling in field definitions in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Add an index to Azure Search service by filling in field definitions in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Search index in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Search index in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: You can quickly prototype an index in Azure Search by creating one in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: You can quickly prototype an index in Azure Search by creating one in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Using the portal is great for proof-of-concept testing, but you can also use it to view schema definitions and resource usage for any index deployed to your service.
trans-unit.target: Using the portal is great for proof-of-concept testing, but you can also use it to view schema definitions and resource usage for any index deployed to your service.

trans-unit.source: To complete this task, make sure you have an Azure Search service that's ready to go.
trans-unit.target: To complete this task, make sure you have an Azure Search service that's ready to go.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><title></title></link> if you need help setting it up.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><title></title></link> if you need help setting it up.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Open the service dashboard of your Azure Search service.
trans-unit.target: Open the service dashboard of your Azure Search service.

trans-unit.source: Here are a few ways to find the dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Here are a few ways to find the dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click Home.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click Home.

trans-unit.source: The home page has tiles for every service in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: The home page has tiles for every service in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Click the tile to open the service dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Click the tile to open the service dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In the Jumpbar, click Browse All > Filter by > Search services to find your Search service in the list.
trans-unit.target: In the Jumpbar, click Browse All > Filter by > Search services to find your Search service in the list.

trans-unit.source: In the service dashboard, you will see a command bar at the top, including one for Add Index.
trans-unit.target: In the service dashboard, you will see a command bar at the top, including one for Add Index.

trans-unit.source: Check the pricing tier.
trans-unit.target: Check the pricing tier.

trans-unit.source: If you have the free version, you can have up to 3 indexes.
trans-unit.target: If you have the free version, you can have up to 3 indexes.

trans-unit.source: You might need to delete one to free up space.
trans-unit.target: You might need to delete one to free up space.

trans-unit.source: To delete an index, click one to slide open a blade.
trans-unit.target: To delete an index, click one to slide open a blade.

trans-unit.source: Click Delete.
trans-unit.target: Click Delete.

trans-unit.source: To create a new index in the portal, click Add Index and give it a name, such as hotels.
trans-unit.target: To create a new index in the portal, click Add Index and give it a name, such as hotels.

trans-unit.source: It can take a minute to create the index, but when it's ready for you to work with, it will appear in the Indexes list.
trans-unit.target: It can take a minute to create the index, but when it's ready for you to work with, it will appear in the Indexes list.

trans-unit.source: Click hotels to open the index definition blade.
trans-unit.target: Click hotels to open the index definition blade.

trans-unit.source: When you create an index in the portal, a required field (id) is created for you.
trans-unit.target: When you create an index in the portal, a required field (id) is created for you.

trans-unit.source: This is the key field, used to uniquely identify each document.
trans-unit.target: This is the key field, used to uniquely identify each document.

trans-unit.source: There is only one field per key (no composite keys), and it is always a string.
trans-unit.target: There is only one field per key (no composite keys), and it is always a string.

trans-unit.source: If you want to rename the key field, it's important to do this step now, during index creation.
trans-unit.target: If you want to rename the key field, it's important to do this step now, during index creation.

trans-unit.source: You won't be able to rename the field after the index is created.
trans-unit.target: You won't be able to rename the field after the index is created.

trans-unit.source: To edit the field name, click the right arrow in the fields list.
trans-unit.target: To edit the field name, click the right arrow in the fields list.

trans-unit.source: Replace id with hotelId.
trans-unit.target: Replace id with hotelId.

trans-unit.source: Click OK on each blade (fields and index) to create the index.
trans-unit.target: Click OK on each blade (fields and index) to create the index.

trans-unit.source: Add fields
trans-unit.target: Add fields

trans-unit.source: In Azure Search, index attributes such as searchable, facetable, and filterable are enabled by default.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Search, index attributes such as searchable, facetable, and filterable are enabled by default.

trans-unit.source: Typically, when you set these attributes, it's usually to turn off search behaviors that don't make sense (for example, sorting or faceting on a description).
trans-unit.target: Typically, when you set these attributes, it's usually to turn off search behaviors that don't make sense (for example, sorting or faceting on a description).

trans-unit.source: The portal is different.
trans-unit.target: The portal is different.

trans-unit.source: In the portal, search behaviors are off by default so that you can select all of the behaviors that apply, on a field by field basis.
trans-unit.target: In the portal, search behaviors are off by default so that you can select all of the behaviors that apply, on a field by field basis.

trans-unit.source: Click Add/Edit fields to add more fields.
trans-unit.target: Click Add/Edit fields to add more fields.

trans-unit.source: In this exercise, we'll recreate the hotels index described in the article How to use Fiddler with Azure Search.
trans-unit.target: In this exercise, we'll recreate the hotels index described in the article How to use Fiddler with Azure Search.

trans-unit.source: Add and configure fields to complete the schema.
trans-unit.target: Add and configure fields to complete the schema.

trans-unit.source: Review <link><linkText>Naming rules</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Supported data types</linkText><title></title></link> for reference information on field names and types.
trans-unit.target: Review <link><linkText>Naming rules</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Supported data types</linkText><title></title></link> for reference information on field names and types.

trans-unit.source: Index attributes consist of the following items:
trans-unit.target: Index attributes consist of the following items:

trans-unit.source: Retrievable specifies whether a field can be returned in a search result.
trans-unit.target: Retrievable specifies whether a field can be returned in a search result.

trans-unit.source: Filterable allows the field to be used in $filter queries.
trans-unit.target: Filterable allows the field to be used in $filter queries.

trans-unit.source: Sortable allows the field to be used as a sort option.
trans-unit.target: Sortable allows the field to be used as a sort option.

trans-unit.source: Facetable allows a field to be used in a faceted navigation structure for self-directed filtering.
trans-unit.target: Facetable allows a field to be used in a faceted navigation structure for self-directed filtering.

trans-unit.source: Typically fields containing repetitive values that you can use to group multiple documents together (for example, multiple documents that fall under a single product or service category) work best as facets.
trans-unit.target: Typically fields containing repetitive values that you can use to group multiple documents together (for example, multiple documents that fall under a single product or service category) work best as facets.

trans-unit.source: Key is the unique ID of each document, used for document look up.
trans-unit.target: Key is the unique ID of each document, used for document look up.

trans-unit.source: Every index must have one key.
trans-unit.target: Every index must have one key.

trans-unit.source: Only one field can be the key, and it must be set to Edm.String.
trans-unit.target: Only one field can be the key, and it must be set to Edm.String.

trans-unit.source: Searchable marks the field as full-text searchable.
trans-unit.target: Searchable marks the field as full-text searchable.

trans-unit.source: To remove any fields you don't want, right-click and select Delete.
trans-unit.target: To remove any fields you don't want, right-click and select Delete.

trans-unit.source: Click OK to save the index you just defined, and then click OK on the Add index page to build the index.
trans-unit.target: Click OK to save the index you just defined, and then click OK on the Add index page to build the index.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Although the index is defined, it won't be ready to use until you load documents.
trans-unit.target: Although the index is defined, it won't be ready to use until you load documents.

trans-unit.source: Assuming that you're recreating the Hotels index, used for testing purposes, you can easily load the small number of documents for that index in <link><linkText>Fiddler</linkText><title></title></link>, using the instructions in the Load Documents section of <link><linkText>How to use Fiddler with Azure Search</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Assuming that you're recreating the Hotels index, used for testing purposes, you can easily load the small number of documents for that index in <link><linkText>Fiddler</linkText><title></title></link>, using the instructions in the Load Documents section of <link><linkText>How to use Fiddler with Azure Search</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can then follow the remaining steps in that article to run some queries.
trans-unit.target: You can then follow the remaining steps in that article to run some queries.

trans-unit.source: Once you are comfortable with the basic index, consider adding a language analyzer or suggester to add multilanguage support or type-ahead suggestions.
trans-unit.target: Once you are comfortable with the basic index, consider adding a language analyzer or suggester to add multilanguage support or type-ahead suggestions.

trans-unit.source: Both features are specified in the index schema.
trans-unit.target: Both features are specified in the index schema.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Language Support</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Create Index</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Language Support</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Create Index</linkText><title></title></link> for more information.
